    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch, float parentAlpha)
      Renders the game piece with various visual effects. This method overrides the default draw behavior to provide custom rendering logic. It handles both the main shape and additional visual elements:
      • Draws a selection indicator (black filled circle) if the piece is selected.
      • Applies dynamic color modulation to the piece, including grayscale for blocked pieces and time-based pulsating hues.
      • Renders a gradient-filled rectangle with corner-specific shading variations.
      • Overlays a texture if pieceTexture is provided.
      • Adds shadow and highlight effects using triangles to simulate depth.
      • Draws a darker border outline around the piece.
      • Displays the pieceId in the top-right corner with adjustable font color and scaling.
      Temporarily interrupts the provided Batch to use ShapeRenderer for custom shapes and effects, then restores the batch for subsequent rendering.
      Overrides:
      draw in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      Parameters:
      batch - The SpriteBatch used for rendering. Temporarily paused for custom shape rendering.
      parentAlpha - The parent actor's alpha value for transparency inheritance.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(float width, float height)
      Sets the size of this component and updates the associated rectangle to match the new dimensions. This method delegates the size adjustment to the superclass implementation and then synchronizes the dimensions of the internal rectangle with the specified width and height.
      Overrides:
      setSize in class com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      Parameters:
      width - the new width for the component and rectangle, in pixels
      height - the new height for the component and rectangle, in pixels

    • getRectangle

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle getRectangle()
      Returns the Rectangle instance representing the current bounds of this object. The returned rectangle contains the position (x, y) and dimensions (width, height) that define the object's geometric boundaries. Modifications to the returned Rectangle will directly affect the internal state of this object, as it is not a defensive copy.
      Returns:
      the Rectangle instance describing this object's bounds; never null.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Releases system resources associated with this object's graphical assets. Specifically, disposes the pieceTexture (if it is not null) and the font. This method should be called when this object is no longer in use to free memory and prevent resource leaks. After calling this method, the assets should not be reused.
